page.title: 14TOURISM
page.content: {The River}is used by pleasure craft travelling along the Ouse. On average, 30-40 boats pass through the lock during the week and 50-60 on a weekend. A full time lock keeper is employed by the Water Authority. The Pike and Eel public house has mooring facilities and there is a small marina. {The Caravan Site}attracts visitors from all over the world. There are 11 permanent caravans on the 4.7 acre site, although there is room for 90. The busiest time is during the summer months but the site is open from March to November. Amenities include toilets, showers, laundry, club room, bar, t.v.room and playground. {The Windmill}on the outskirts of the village has been in existence for 300 years. A{Bed & Breakfast}lodging is available
